page.title: 03TREVERVA FARM
page.content: Treverva farm used to be sited on the southern side of Treverva,but now it has moved up to right opposite the Post Office.Treverva farm belongs to Mr.Ivor Dunstan and he has lived there all his life(40 years).He owns 20 hectares comprising mainly of pasture. Every morning his two employees check the number of cattle,then they tend the grassland with manure. The farmer keeps 500 cows and a few bulls.The calves from the suckler herd are fattened and sold.He sends his lifestock to an abatoir in Northampton. He said"The turnover of his farm in a year is comparable to that of his father's life time!"
